parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Middle - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: From para and ginomai; to become near, i.e. Approach; by implication, to appear publicly.
To, towards, with. A strengthened form of pro; a preposition of direction; forward to, i.e. Toward.
Of Hebrew origin; Jesus, the name of our Lord and two other Israelites.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: From para and kaleo; to call near, i.e. Invite, invoke.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
Diligently, earnestly, zealously. Adverb from spoudaios; earnestly, promptly.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
Worthy, worthy of, deserving, comparable, suitable. Probably from ago; deserving, comparable or suitable.

parse: Verb - Future Indicative Middle - 2nd Person Singular
str2: From para and echo; to hold near, i.e. Present, afford, exhibit, furnish occasion.
